definitions: person without any clothing covering their body
artistic work depicting unclothed human figure as subject
pale pinkish-beige color resembling human skin tone
examples: The artist sketched nudes during her anatomy classes
Photography students studied classical nudes in Renaissance paintings
Michelangelo's nudes demonstrate mastery of human anatomy perfectly
The museum displayed bronze nudes from ancient Greece
She chose nude pumps to elongate her legs visually
The decorator suggested nude curtains for the minimalist bedroom

definitions: light push or poke with elbow to get attention
indirect suggestion or encouragement toward particular action or behavior
examples: She gave him a nudge when he started snoring
The child's nudge reminded her mother about dessert
The government's tax incentives nudge citizens toward green energy
His mentor's nudge helped him apply for the promotion

definitions: person who practices social nudity as lifestyle or philosophy
examples: The nudist colony welcomed visitors during their open house
Many nudists believe clothing creates unnecessary social barriers

definitions: condition of being without clothing or covering
representation of unclothed human form in art or media
examples: Public nudity remains illegal in most urban areas worldwide
The documentary explored cultural attitudes toward nudity across societies
Renaissance art frequently featured nudity in religious contexts
The film's nudity earned it a restricted rating classification

definitions: naturally occurring lump of precious metal, especially gold
breaded and fried piece of processed chicken or fish
small but valuable piece of information or wisdom
examples: Prospectors discovered gold nuggets in the riverbed last summer
The museum displayed the largest nugget ever found locally
Children often prefer chicken nuggets to other menu items
The restaurant serves fish nuggets with tartar sauce
His presentation contained several nuggets of practical business advice
The biography revealed fascinating nuggets about the artist's youth

definitions: person or thing causing inconvenience or annoyance persistently
legal term for activity interfering with others' use of property
examples: Mosquitoes become a nuisance during summer evening gatherings
The barking dog had become a neighborhood nuisance
The factory's emissions constituted a public nuisance requiring intervention
Residents filed a nuisance complaint about the noisy construction

definitions: nuclear bomb or missile used as military weapon
informal term for heating food in a microwave oven
examples: Countries signed treaties limiting the proliferation of nukes
The Cold War featured an arms race involving nukes
Just nuke the leftovers for two minutes before serving
She decided to nuke her coffee when it got cold

definitions: formal cancellation or invalidation of legal decision or law
act of making something legally invalid or without effect
examples: The court ordered nullification of the unconstitutional statute immediately
States attempted nullification of federal laws they opposed historically
Contract nullification requires proof of fraud or coercion typically
The judge's nullification of the verdict shocked legal observers

definitions: mathematical value expressed by word or symbol representing quantity
sequence of digits used for identification or reference purposes
indefinite or particular quantity of things or people counted
individual song or dance performance in theatrical production
examples: The number seven holds significance in many cultural traditions
Children learn to recognize numbers before learning arithmetic operations
Please provide your account number for verification purposes today
The tracking number allows customers to monitor their shipments
A large number of voters participated in yesterday's election
The number of applicants exceeded our initial expectations significantly
The chorus performed three numbers before the grand finale
Her cabaret number brought the audience to their feet

definitions: systematic method of assigning numbers to items in sequence
process of counting or calculating total quantity of something
examples: The numbering system starts from zero in computer programming
Page numbering helps readers navigate through lengthy documents easily
The numbering of houses follows odd-even patterns on streets
Automatic numbering eliminates errors in sequential document formatting

definitions: ability to understand and work with numbers in daily life
examples: Basic numeracy skills help adults manage personal finances effectively
The curriculum emphasizes numeracy alongside literacy development for students

definitions: symbol or figure representing a number in writing
written character denoting numerical value in counting system
examples: Roman numerals appear on clock faces and building cornerstones
Arabic numerals replaced Roman ones for most mathematical purposes
The document uses numerals instead of spelling out numbers
Children practice writing numerals during their mathematics lessons daily

definitions: number above the line in a common fraction indicating parts taken
examples: In the fraction three-fourths, three is the numerator
Students often confuse the numerator with the denominator initially

definitions: belief system attributing mystical significance to numbers and their combinations
examples: Some people consult numerology before making important life decisions
Numerology associates personality traits with birth dates and names

definitions: woman belonging to religious order living under vows of poverty, chastity, obedience
examples: The nun devoted her life to teaching orphaned children
Medieval nuns preserved ancient texts through careful manuscript copying

definitions: building or group of buildings where nuns live in religious community
examples: The ancient nunnery stood peacefully overlooking the valley below
She entered the nunnery after her husband's death historically

definitions: healthcare professional trained to care for sick or injured patients
person employed to care for young children in private household
examples: The emergency room nurse quickly assessed the patient's condition
Nurses monitor vital signs throughout patients' hospital stays regularly
The family hired a nurse to help with their newborn
Victorian families often employed nurses for their children's care

definitions: room in house specially furnished for young children
place where plants are grown for sale or transplanting
facility providing daytime care for preschool children
examples: They painted the nursery pale yellow before the baby arrived
The nursery contained a crib, changing table, and rocking chair
The nursery specializes in native plants for local gardens
Garden centers buy wholesale from commercial nurseries each spring
Working parents rely on nursery care for their toddlers
The nursery accepts children from six months old onwards

definitions: person who owns or works in plant nursery growing plants commercially
examples: The nurseryman recommended drought-resistant varieties for our climate
Experienced nurserymen understand optimal growing conditions for each species

definitions: profession or practice of caring for sick and injured people
act of feeding baby with milk from the breast
examples: She pursued nursing after witnessing excellent hospital care firsthand
Modern nursing combines scientific knowledge with compassionate patient care
Nursing provides essential nutrients and antibodies to newborn infants
Many mothers continue nursing beyond their baby's first year

definitions: process of caring for and encouraging growth or development
environmental factors affecting development as opposed to genetic inheritance
examples: Parents nurture their children through love and consistent support
Teachers nurture students' curiosity through engaging learning experiences
The nature versus nurture debate examines human development factors
Research shows nurture significantly impacts personality development throughout life

definitions: hard-shelled fruit of certain trees containing edible kernel
metal fastener with threaded hole screwed onto matching bolt
informal term for person extremely enthusiastic about particular activity
examples: Squirrels gather nuts throughout autumn for winter storage needs
Almonds and walnuts are popular nuts in baking recipes
Tighten the nut carefully to avoid stripping the threads
The mechanic replaced the rusted nuts on the wheel
He's a complete nut about vintage motorcycle restoration projects
Photography nuts spend thousands on camera equipment annually

definitions: device designed for cracking open hard shells of nuts
decorative wooden soldier figure traditionally associated with Christmas
famous ballet composed by Tchaikovsky performed during holiday season
examples: The antique nutcracker efficiently cracked even the toughest walnuts
She keeps a nutcracker in the kitchen drawer year-round
Collectors display nutcracker figures prominently during the holiday season
German nutcrackers feature intricate carved details and bright colors
The Nutcracker ballet attracts families every December without fail
Local dance schools perform The Nutcracker as annual tradition

definitions: aromatic spice made from seed of tropical evergreen tree
soccer move where player kicks ball between opponent's legs
examples: Fresh nutmeg adds warmth to holiday eggnog and pumpkin pie
The recipe calls for freshly grated nutmeg, not pre-ground
The striker's nutmeg left the defender completely off balance
Skillful players use the nutmeg to embarrass opposing defenders

definitions: substance providing nourishment essential for growth and maintenance of life
examples: Plants absorb nutrients through their root systems from soil
Essential nutrients include vitamins, minerals, proteins, and healthy fats

definitions: scientific study of nutrients and how body uses them
process of providing or obtaining food necessary for health and growth
examples: She studied nutrition to become a registered dietitian professional
Sports nutrition focuses on optimizing athletic performance through diet
Proper nutrition during pregnancy supports healthy fetal development significantly
Hospital patients receive nutrition through carefully planned meal programs

definitions: professional who advises on matters of food and nutrition impacts on health
examples: The nutritionist created personalized meal plans for each client
School nutritionists ensure cafeteria meals meet dietary guidelines effectively

definitions: hard outer covering or shell of a nut
extremely brief statement or summary of something complex
examples: Walnut nutshells make excellent natural mulch for gardens
Artists create miniature sculptures inside actual nutshells sometimes
In a nutshell, the proposal reduces costs while improving efficiency
She explained quantum physics in a nutshell during lunch

definitions: British informal term for person considered mad or eccentric
examples: That nutter drives his motorcycle at dangerous speeds constantly
Only a complete nutter would swim in freezing water

definitions: strong lightweight synthetic polymer used in textiles and plastics
stockings or tights made from nylon fabric material
examples: Nylon rope resists water damage better than natural fibers
Parachutes use nylon fabric for its strength and lightness
Women queued for nylons when they became available post-war
Sheer nylons remain popular for formal occasions today

definitions: minor female nature deity in Greek and Roman mythology
immature form of insect that undergoes gradual metamorphosis
examples: Ancient Greeks believed nymphs inhabited forests, rivers, and mountains
The painting depicts wood nymphs dancing in moonlit groves
Dragonfly nymphs live underwater before emerging as flying adults
The mayfly nymph molts several times before reaching maturity

definitions: large deciduous or evergreen tree producing acorns and valuable timber
hard durable wood from oak trees used in furniture and construction
examples: The ancient oak tree has stood for over three hundred years
Squirrels gather acorns from oak trees every autumn season
Oak flooring adds warmth and value to residential properties
The craftsman selected white oak for the dining table

definitions: long pole with flat blade used for rowing or steering boat
examples: The rower gripped both oars firmly against the current
Ancient galleys required dozens of oars for propulsion power

definitions: cereal plant cultivated for its edible grain seeds
seeds of oat plant used as food for humans and animals
examples: Farmers rotate oat crops with wheat to maintain soil health
Wild oats grow as weeds in many agricultural fields
Steel-cut oats provide more texture than instant oatmeal varieties
Horses consume oats as a primary feed grain source

definitions: solemn promise often invoking divine witness regarding future action or behavior
profane or offensive word or expression used in anger
examples: Doctors take the Hippocratic oath before beginning medical practice
Witnesses swear an oath to tell the truth in court
The sailor muttered oaths when the rope slipped through his hands
His string of oaths shocked the nearby elderly passengers

definitions: meal made from ground or rolled oats boiled in water or milk
coarsely ground oats used in cooking and baking
examples: She prepares oatmeal with cinnamon and fresh berries daily
Instant oatmeal provides quick breakfast for busy mornings
The recipe requires two cups of oatmeal for the cookies
Oatmeal adds fiber and texture to homemade bread loaves

definitions: act of obeying orders, laws, or instructions from authority figures
examples: Military training emphasizes obedience to commanding officers without question
The dog's obedience earned praise from its trainer consistently

definitions: tall four-sided narrow tapering monument ending in pyramid-like shape at top
examples: The ancient Egyptian obelisk stands in the city square
Washington Monument is technically an obelisk in architectural terms

definitions: medical condition characterized by excessive accumulation of body fat affecting health
examples: Childhood obesity rates have increased significantly over recent decades worldwide
The doctor discussed obesity-related health risks during the consultation

definitions: action of making something obscure, unclear, or unintelligible deliberately
examples: Legal obfuscation makes contracts difficult for consumers to understand
The politician's obfuscation avoided answering the direct question completely

definitions: broad sash worn around waist of Japanese kimono or judo uniform
examples: The silk obi complemented her formal kimono perfectly
Martial artists tie their obi according to rank traditionally

definitions: published notice of death including brief biography of deceased person
examples: The newspaper printed his obituary with a photograph from his youth
She wrote obituaries for the local paper as freelance work

definitions: material thing that can be seen and touched physically
person or thing toward which thought, feeling, or action is directed
noun or noun phrase governed by active transitive verb or preposition
examples: The mysterious object appeared to be made of metal
Museum objects require careful preservation and climate control measures
The object of the game is capturing the opponent's king
She became the object of everyone's admiration and envy
In 'throw the ball,' ball is the direct object
Students identify objects and subjects in sentence diagrams regularly

definitions: action of treating person as object or thing without regard to dignity
examples: Critics argue that advertising promotes objectification of women's bodies
The study examined objectification in workplace harassment cases nationwide

definitions: expression or feeling of disapproval or opposition to something
formal protest raised in court regarding testimony or procedure
examples: Several members raised objections to the proposed budget changes
Her main objection concerned the project's environmental impact significantly
The lawyer's objection was sustained by the presiding judge
Defense attorneys frequently make objections during cross-examination proceedings

definitions: something aimed at or sought as goal to be achieved
quality of being based on facts rather than personal feelings
examples: The company's primary objective is increasing market share globally
Military objectives must align with broader strategic goals effectively
Scientific research requires objective analysis of experimental data consistently
Journalists strive for objective reporting despite personal opinions

definitions: quality of being uninfluenced by emotions or personal prejudices in judgments
examples: Scientific objectivity requires researchers to acknowledge potential biases openly
The judge maintained objectivity despite media pressure surrounding the case

definitions: person who expresses disagreement or refuses participation based on principles
examples: Conscientious objectors refused military service on moral grounds historically
The lone objector prevented unanimous approval of the proposal

definitions: action or course of action required by moral or legal necessity
formal agreement to pay money or perform service legally binding
examples: Parents have legal obligations to provide for their children
Professional obligations sometimes conflict with personal preferences unfortunately
The company met all financial obligations to creditors on schedule
Contractual obligations remain binding despite ownership changes typically

definitions: line or surface slanting at angle neither perpendicular nor parallel
indirect or evasive way of expressing or approaching something
examples: The oblique angle creates interesting shadows in architectural photography
Oblique muscles run diagonally across the abdominal wall
His oblique reference to past mistakes confused many listeners
The author makes oblique criticisms through fictional characters subtly
